nl_problem:
Three cubes have edges of lengths 4,5 and 6 .

The average (mean) of their volumes is
(A) 120
(B) 125
(C) 1125
(D) 261
(E) 135

![](https://cdn.mathpix.com/cropped/2024_04_20_ac36362783317e0251fdg-104.jpg?height=249&width=379&top_left_y=1220&top_left_x=1293)
formal_statement:
forall e1, e2, e3, v1, v2, v3, partial_sum, total_sum, avg N_pos:
        e1 = 4
        e2 = 5
        e3 = 6
        v1 = e1 ^ 3
        v2 = e2 ^ 3
        v3 = e3 ^ 3
        partial_sum = v1 + v2
        total_sum = partial_sum + v3
        avg = total_sum / 3
        =>:
            avg = 135
formal_code:
claim:
    forall e1, e2, e3, v1, v2, v3, partial_sum, total_sum, avg N_pos:
        e1 = 4
        e2 = 5
        e3 = 6
        v1 = e1 ^ 3
        v2 = e2 ^ 3
        v3 = e3 ^ 3
        partial_sum = v1 + v2
        total_sum = partial_sum + v3
        avg = total_sum / 3
        =>:
            avg = 135
    prove:
        v1 = 4 ^ 3
        v1 = 64

        v2 = 5 ^ 3
        v2 = 125

        v3 = 6 ^ 3
        v3 = 216

        partial_sum = v1 + v2
        partial_sum = 64 + 125
        partial_sum = 189

        total_sum = partial_sum + v3
        total_sum = 189 + 216
        total_sum = 405

        avg = total_sum / 3
        avg = 405 / 3
        avg = 135
